title: ATypI 2003 Vancouver Picture Board
content:
Hi fellas!   
I thought it would be nice to have a list where everybody posts links to their pictures from ATypI 2003.   
   
So I'll make a start with two:   
   
Gisela Will's pictures   
 [http://www.zeichen-der-zeit.de/vancouver](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518123016/http:/www.zeichen-der-zeit.de/vancouver)   
   
And my very own gallery   
 [http://homepage.mac.com/frankjonen](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518123016/http:/homepage.mac.com/frankjonen)   
   
   
enjoy and have some waffles!
author: frankjonen

comments.content:
Damn! Damn! Damn!   
I should have borrowed the money and gone to Vancouver.   
   
Nice pictures Frank.   
You've ruined my day ;-)   
   
Matha

Loving the Keith Tam as Ray Charles shot!   
   
 [http://www.keithtamdesign.com/atypi03/atypi03-Pages/Image89.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518123016/http:/www.keithtamdesign.com/atypi03/atypi03-Pages/Image89.html)

Thank you all very much for your nice comments!   
   
Matha: To ruin your day even more, there were book on Irish typography on the Auction! I couldn't manage to get one, wonder who got them?   
   
Jim: Thanks for sharing the magic and letting us dwell in the holy halls of typecasting ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518123016im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

Only 4 meters away! That's a shame... maybe it was the price... Just curious for I'm working on a script face with Gï¿½lic ligatures. but I think amazon.com will do ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518123016im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
   
Thanks Tiffany!

I don't have many photos from ATypI (too busy to take any), but here are a couple of images of Brian Morgan's lovely poster and signage.   
   
 ![ATypI poster and signage](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518123016im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/30/18660.jpg)   
   
In case anyone wants to know what the place looked like _before_ the massed hordes of international typedom descended on it, I'll leave [these planning pictures](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518123016/http:/www.tiro.com/atypi/eciad.html) online for a little longer.
Does John Downer's striptease tendencies scare anyone? And, has he been working out?
Yes, John's compulsion to take off clothes in front of crowds of people is somewhat worrying. He certainly works out: he's a competetive swimmer.

From what I gather he was on the water polo team that   
won the national championship for over 50s. Not bad at all!   
   
hhp

Well, I might as well follow the leader-   
   
 [www.eciad.bc.ca/~evensz/zedesign.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518123016/http:/www.eciad.bc.ca/~evensz/zedesign.html)   
   
-click on the ATypI link in center of page   
   
beware, most of these were taken during the "open/free bar hours."

Here's a few more shots that I took in and around the ECIAD campus. Nothing fancy I'm afraid.   
   
 [http://homepage.mac.com/splorp/PhotoAlbum4.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518123016/http:/homepage.mac.com/splorp/PhotoAlbum4.html)   
   
I should probably post the pictures I took in Minneapolis during TypeCon as well...
